import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Exchange asset"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"post"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/assets/exchange"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Exchanges an asset between users and optionally transfers ownership from one asset to another. Use this for device swap scenarios, loaner exchanges, or consolidating user assignments during refresh cycles.

**Prerequisites**
1. **OwnerId** - Identify the target owner via [POST /api/v1.0/search](/docs/api/users/search-users).
2. **FromAssetId / ToAssetId** - Locate the assets via [POST /api/v1.0/assets/search](/docs/api/assets/keyword-search-assets) and capture `Items[].AssetId`.

**Workflow Example**
1. Identify the outgoing and incoming assets and the receiving user.
2. [POST /api/v1.0/assets/exchange](/docs/api/assets/exchange-asset) with the `OwnerId` and `FromAssetId`/`ToAssetId` values.
3. Review the action response to confirm the swap completed.

**Minimal Required Fields**: include at least one asset reference (`FromAssetId` or `ToAssetId`) and the `OwnerId` when assigning the device to a user.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={undefined}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"required":true,"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"object","description":"Request to exchange an asset between users","properties":{"OwnerId":{"type":"string","format":"uuid","nullable":true,"description":"UUID of the new owner"},"FromAssetId":{"type":"string","format":"uuid","nullable":true,"description":"UUID of the asset to exchange from"},"ToAssetId":{"type":"string","format":"uuid","nullable":true,"description":"UUID of the asset to exchange to"},"TicketId":{"type":"string","format":"uuid","nullable":true,"description":"Associated ticket for the exchange"}},"title":"AssetExchangeRequest"}}}}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>
